# fdh: A package for estimating nonconvex frontier models

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

*fdh* provides simple ways, using enumeration algorithms, for estimating 
different Farrell distance function under different returns to scale 
assumptions:

- **Input Technical Efficiency**
  - **Variable Returns to Scale** (vrs)

![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_i\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle&space;\min_{\mathbf{y}^\circ&space;\leq&space;\mathbf{y}_n}&space;\displaystyle&space;\max_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}&space;\left\lbrace&space;\frac{x_{kn}}{x_k^\circ}&space;\right\rbrace)

  - **Constant Returns to Scale** (crs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_i&space;\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\max_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}&space;\frac{x_{kn}}{x_k^\circ}\cdot\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}\right\})
  
  - **Nonicreasing Returns to Scale** (nirs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_i\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle\min_{\mathbf{y}^\circ&space;\leq&space;\mathbf{y}_n}\left\{\displaystyle\max_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_{kn}}{x_k^\circ}\cdot\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}\right\})
  
  - **Nondecreasing Returns to Scale** (ndrs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_i\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}'&space;\left\{\displaystyle{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}{\max}\frac{x_{kn}}{x_k^\circ}\cdot&space;\max&space;\left\{\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}},&space;1\right\}\right\})

- **Output Technical Efficiency**
  - **Variable Returns to Scale** (vrs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_o\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle\max_{\mathbf{x}^\circ&space;\geq&space;\mathbf{x}_n}\displaystyle\min_{q=1,\cdots,&space;Q}\left\{\frac{y_{qn}}{y_q^\circ}\right\})
  
  - **Constant Returns to Scale** (crs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_o\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=\displaystyle\max_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\min_{q=1,\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_{qn}}{y_q^\circ}\cdot\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right\})
  
  - **Nonicreasing Returns to Scale** (nirs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_o\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle\max_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\min_{q=1,\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_{qn}}{y_q^\circ}\cdot&space;\min&space;\left\{\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}},&space;1\right\}\right\})
  
  - **Nondecreasing Returns to Scale** (ndrs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_o\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle\max_{\mathbf{x}^\circ&space;\geq&space;\mathbf{x}_n}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\min_{q=1,\cdots,&space;Q}&space;\frac{y_{qn}}{y_q^\circ}\cdot\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right\})
  
- **Graph Technical Efficiency**
For this orientation, let's first define:

![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;\delta&space;=&space;\left(\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}&space;\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}&space;\cdot&space;\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}&space;\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right)^{1/2})

  - **Variable Returns to Scale** (vrs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_{GR}\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)=\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\max\left(\displaystyle\max_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_{kn}}{x_k^\circ},\displaystyle\max_{q=1,\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}\right)\right\})
  
  - **Constant Returns to Scale** (crs)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_{GR}\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}\Big/\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right\}^{1/2})
  
  Else
  
  ![equation]()
  
  - **Nonicreasing Returns to Scale** (nirs)
  
  If ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;\delta&space;\leq&space;1)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_{GR}\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}\Big/\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right\}^{1/2})
  
  Else
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_{GR}\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=&space;\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}\left\{\max\left[\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}},&space;\left(\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right)^{-1}&space;\right]\right\})
  
  - **Nondecreasing Returns to Scale** (ndrs)
  
  If ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;\delta&space;\geq&space;1)
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_{GR}\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,&space;\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}&space;\left\{\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}}\Big/\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right\}^{1/2})
  
  Else
  
  ![equation](https://latex.codecogs.com/svg.image?\inline&space;\large&space;\color{white}&space;E_{GR}\left(\mathbf{x}^\circ,\mathbf{y}^\circ\right)&space;=&space;\displaystyle\min_{n=1,&space;\cdots,&space;N}\left\{\max\left[\displaystyle\max_{q=1,&space;\cdots,&space;Q}\frac{y_q^\circ}{y_{qn}},&space;\left(\displaystyle\min_{k=1,\cdots,&space;K}\frac{x_k^\circ}{x_{kn}}\right)^{-1}&space;\right]\right\})

*fdh* also offers the possiblity of estimating the minimum cost as well as the 
maximum revenue in addition to their corresponding cost efficiency and revenue 
efficiency scores. 

For large datasets, the `parallel` can be used to speed up computations.

## Installation

You can install the development version of fdh from 
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("hdakpo/fdh")
```
